It can't find that I have the Java Developement Kit installed.
I downloaded the binary from the sun website.
please install the sun jdk deb from the ubuntu repos
java5 is in the edgy repos, and java6 in the feisty repos
the latter installs fine on edgy too, but be carefull not to upgrade to feisty itself
the deb will set up /usr/bin/java to the right path etc...
btw, you can set JAVA_HOME in your /home/$USER/.bashrc
using the deb is also better for uninstalling etc
moreover... in the past, the .bin from Sun now and then overwrote things it should not have...
alternatively to adding it to your .bashrc, you can also prepend JAVA_HOME=/usr/share/jvm/java-bla to your command, e.g. handy when running ant:
